intro: Keteleeria evelyniana subsp. hainanensis, commonly known as the Hainan fir, is a coniferous tree native to the mountainous regions of Hainan Island in China. It belongs to the family Pinaceae and is characterized by its needle-like leaves and cone-bearing structure. The plant typically grows at elevations between 800 and 1,500 meters, thriving in humid and temperate climates. Its botanical features include a tall, slender trunk and a conical crown, making it a distinctive component of its native forest ecosystems. This subspecies plays an important role in the biodiversity and ecological balance of its habitat.
